etymology.description: Depicts 人(人) (rén, "person") facing forward -> phonetic borrowing for 大 (dà, "big")
etymology.interpretation: The character 大 (dà, "big") originally depicted a person. It was phonetically borrowed for its current meaning, rather than literally representing the concept of 'bigness', differing from other character formations.

examples.chinese: 这个房间很大(這個房間很大)。
他有一个大梦想(他有一個大夢想)，希望改变世界(希望改變世界)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǒu yīgè dà mèngxiǎng, xīwàng gǎibiàn shìjiè.
examples.english: He has a great dream, hoping to change the world.
The large tree blocks the sky.
